it.apice.sapere.management
Class DefaultReactionsScheduler

java.lang.Object
  it.apice.sapere.management.DefaultReactionsScheduler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReactionManagerObserver, ReactionsScheduler
public class DefaultReactionsScheduler
extends Object
implements ReactionsScheduler

This class provides a default implementation of a ReactionsScheduler.

Default behaviour consists in providing a CTMC-based scheduling function and no optimization on dependency check (always abort).

Author:
Paolo Contessi

checkDependencies

public final void checkDependencies(SpaceEvent ev,
                                    MatchingEcolaw law)
                             throws AbortException
Description copied from interface: ReactionsScheduler

Checks if the given SpaceEvent has modified a precondition for the provided eco-law. If so an AbortException should be raised in order to revise the scheduling.

Specified by:
checkDependencies in interface ReactionsScheduler
Parameters:
ev - The occurred event
law - The law that is going to be scheduled
Throws:
AbortException - Next reaction should be re-scheduled

eval

public final SchedulableMatchResult eval(MatchResult mResult)
                                  throws SAPEREException
Description copied from interface: ReactionsScheduler

Evaluates the match and computes when the relative eco-law can be scheduled.

Specified by:
eval in interface ReactionsScheduler
Parameters:
mResult - Eco-law's proposed bindings
Returns:
A SchedulableMatchResult which provides bindings and how many milliseconds should be waited before scheduling the eco-law (bound to provided values).
Throws:
SAPEREException - Cannot compute a rate

eval

public final SchedulableMatchResult[] eval(MatchResult[] mResults)
                                    throws SAPEREException
Description copied from interface: ReactionsScheduler

Evaluates scheduling time over a list of MatchResults.

Specified by:
eval in interface ReactionsScheduler
Parameters:
mResults - Eco-law's proposed bindings list
Returns:
A list of SchedulableMatchResult, each one indicating how many milliseconds should be waited before scheduling the eco-law (bound to provided values).
Throws:
SAPEREException - Cannot compute a rate
